questions.question: ……………………. his disability, he has never failed at anything.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition expressing contrast.

questions.question: She has her shortcomings …………………………, I can’t help liking her.
questions.description: However is used to introduce a contrasting idea.

questions.question: You should wait here ……………………….. I return.
questions.description: Either until or till is possible here.

questions.question: ………………………. you take these tablets, you won’t get well.
questions.description: Unless means if not. If you do not take these tablets, you won't get well.

questions.question: Something must have fallen ………………………. I heard a thud.
questions.description: For is possible here in a formal style. Because is also correct.

questions.question: ……………………….. he is not educated, he is very intelligent.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ………………………. it was already late, we called it a day.
…………………….. you are free tomorrow, we can go for a drive.
I received the letter two days ……………………..
questions.description: Ago is used to count back from a present moment.

questions.question: This is the house …………………………. he was born.
It has been months ………………………. I heard anything from her.
